data.title: Drake Accused By Rye Rye Of Stealing Her Vocalsâ€”Again: 'This Sent Me Into A Deep Depression'
data.meta_description: Drake is now catching the side eye of singer Rye Rye, who is accusing the rapper of using her vocals without credit on the â€œCalling For Youâ€ track featuring 21 Savage . Rye Rye unleashed her fury on Twitter, saying Drake has used her work without credit multiple times. â€œREALLY @Drake MY VOCALS AGAIN?â€ Rye Rye tweeted. â€œ& NO CREDIT? I really wanna be flattered but I feel like itâ€™s trolling ATP OMG â€¦one of my fave artists doing this I donâ€™t know how to feel anymore. But thank you for reminding me that my 15 year old vocals are still legendary. This is not funny this sent me into a deep depression and made me angry inside the first time. Now I gotta relive this again after I was semi trying to push through. WTF I wanna be happy but like how.â€ REALLY @Drake MY VOCALS AGAIN? & NO CREDIT? I really wanna be flattered but I feel like itâ€™s trolling ATP OMG â€¦one of my fave artists doing this I donâ€™t know how to feel anymore ğŸ˜¤ğŸ˜¤ğŸ˜’ğŸ˜ but thank you for reminding me that my 15 year old vocals are...
data.text:
The Baltimore artist continued to express her anger in a series of tweets.

â€œLike how tf lil John chair squeaking sample get credited on currents over my actual voice WTF,â€ she wrote. â€œIâ€™m feeling angry inside all over again.. I feel so disrespected.. guess thatâ€™s how the game goes huh lol bettttt. Ruined my whole f***in day I donâ€™t even wanna fly no more. Sitting here crying but I canâ€™t be a sucker.â€

Rye Rye, however, vowed to use the disappointment as motivation.

â€œI always been strong and I feel it in the universe ima get what I deserve. Make me wanna turn into a b***h but ima let me heart keep being pure,â€ she wrote according to Hot new Hip Hop. â€œI worked so hard at 15 when I created them vocals. I get that theyâ€™re legendary I love that yall f**k with it. But damn at first yall might didnâ€™t know where the sample came from. Now itâ€™s been made clear and yall still just canâ€™t give credit.â€

While some people said itâ€™s the producersâ€™ fault, not Drakeâ€™s, Rye Rye said there is no excuse.

â€œWhen I used the â€˜anything you can do I can do betterâ€™ sample in my song it was my label job to CLEAR that before it came out. This for all the ppl saying itâ€™s the producers,â€ she wrote. â€œYea ultimately BUT if youâ€™re on a major they should be clearing all samples prior to releasing. And Iâ€™m not venting to social media thinking itâ€™s gonna get me paid. But some ppl can see it and offer help/advice. Also itâ€™s my voice ppl know it and bringing it to my attention so I can speak on it if I want tf yall weird af.â€

Although some critics say itâ€™s not a big deal for Drake to sample one word, Rye Rye is taking the issue seriously.

â€œSo why did lil Jon chair squeaking sound get credited and thatâ€™s just a sound from a chair?? lol,â€ she said in response to one critic. â€œI have a right to be credit if they take anything off MY ORIGINAL SONG you sound foolish.â€
